description.value:
Goliaths share a number of traits in common with each other.

Age. Goliaths have lifespans comparable to humans. They enter adulthood in their late teens and usually live less than a century.

Size. Goliaths are between 7 and 8 feet tall and weigh between 280 and 340 pounds. Your size is Medium.

Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Stone's Endurance. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.races.RZzClbmnTYV1Uhpw]{Stone's Endurance} You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a d12. Add your Constitution score to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Powerful Build. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.races.Gu3XzUVMLkk6Uzc8]{Powerful Build} You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

Mountain Born. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.races.ikTxCJH1kBot8mna]{Mountain Born} You're acclimated to high altitude, including elevations about 20,000 feet. You're also naturally adapted to cold climates, and have resistance to cold damage.

Foundry Note

You can drag your choices from the above onto your character sheet and it will automatically update.
